intro: Cinchona lutescens, commonly known as the yellow cinchona, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant is notable for its historical use in the production of quinine, although it is less commonly cultivated for this purpose today. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Cinchona lutescens is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes grown in botanical gardens.
